channel.description: Twitter feed for: @quantymacro. Generated by nitter.freedit.eu

item.title: gf is landing at Heathrow early tmr morning and idw wake up early so I just casually drop some money (big amount) to stay in a hotel near Heathrow tonight. this is the kind of prestigious lifestyle you can only live once you’ve developed quantitative acumen to solve the market.
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro

item.title: chat should I tell my PM that financial markets are fat-tailed and non-linear? never heard him mention any of these words. quite worried he might not be aware of these important findings (understandable of course, few know this). thanks in advance
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro

item.title: going into CPI, my signals are positioned for the exact opposite of how the team’s signals are positioned. Mr Negative Correlation never disappoints. lfg

item.title:
on 14th Aug 2024, I had extremely profound thoughts on cross-validation, that warrants an article
normally when I have ideas I would write the outline so I don't forget things. but I didn't, because it was so profound I was sure I won't forget
now I completely forgot abt it
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro

item.title: R to @quantymacro: and I only know how to scan for keywords — one time I was too embarrassed to google/ask in front of others so I got “prawns ceviche” expecting it to be some banging juicy grilled prawns and ended up being very disappointed. thankfully it was someone’s treat

item.title: another time where my ratchet self really shows is when in restaurants instead of saying what I want to order I point to the item on the menu instead bcs I can’t pronounce most of them

item.title:
we listen and we don’t judge
up until today I had no idea what my notice/non compete is, or the difference between the two. I did read the contract a few times before but I still didn’t understand and I was too scared to ask.
but today I found out what they are
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:

item.title:
RT by @quantymacro: looked through some student CVs for quant roles. IMO a quick (& extreme) heuristic is that if your experiences can also be written in someone else’s CV, they’re too vague/not specific enough
“utilised ML techniques to develop quant strategy” isn’t rly saying anything. gl all🙏
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
looked through some student CVs for quant roles. IMO a quick (& extreme) heuristic is that if your experiences can also be written in someone else’s CV, they’re too vague/not specific enough

“utilised ML techniques to develop quant strategy” isn’t rly saying anything.
gl all🙏

item.title: Idk much about UK so I joined this sub to learn but why do ppl in this sub act like being a HENRY is an out of the body experience where the world around you changes 180 degrees like bruv you’re just sick wtf does that have to do with you being a HENRY tf pls be normal ty

item.title: is making partner at Citadel and managing your own book at 35 considered good? I’ve always thought if you don’t become the head of quant research by 20 you’re ngmi. but this is something I’d know nothing about since I’ve never ran my own book
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro

item.title: actually no I take it back. here I wasn’t doing much modelling — I was doing more ad-hoc stuffs for the team. now I spend 90% of my time fitting shitty models models at work I have 0 interest in fitting shitty models at home lmao I just wanna go back home and watch Netflix
